title: Get available stores under an ad account

headers.name: Access-Token
headers.description: Authorized access token. For details, see Authentication .

parameters.name: store_id
parameters.description: ID of the first-party store (TikTok Shop) that you want to filter by. If not specified, the results for all available store_id under the specified advertiser account will be returned. Note : To get the TikTok Shop ID, you can use /bc/asset/get/ : When in the response asset_type is TIKTOK_SHOP , the returned asset_id is the TikTok Shop ID.

parameters.name: store_type
parameters.description: Store type that you want to filter by. Enum values: TIKTOK_SHOP (TikTok Shop) . If not specified, the results for all stores under the specified advertiser account will be returned.

top_fields.name: code
top_fields.description: Response code. For the complete list of response codes and descriptions, see Appendix - Return Codes .

top_fields.name: message
top_fields.description: Response message. For details, see Appendix - Return Codes .

fields.name: stores
fields.description: Information about the available stores under the ad account.

fields.name: store_authorized_bc_id
fields.description: ID of the Business Center that is authorized to access the store ( store_id ). One store may be accessed by more than one Business Center.

fields.name: store_id
fields.description: ID of the TikTok Shop. See Create Video Shopping Ads with products from TikTok Shopping-Create an ad group to learn about how to use store_id to create Shopping Ads

fields.name: store_type
fields.description: Store type. Enum values: TIKTOK_SHOP (TikTok Shop).

fields.name: store_code
fields.description: Returned when the store_type of the store is TIKTOK_SHOP . The shop code of the first-party store (TikTok Shop).

fields.name: catalog_id To-be-deprecated
fields.description: ID of the catalog that is bound to the store. One catalog can be bound to only one store.

fields.name: targeting_region_codes
fields.description: Region codes that the store can be used to target. See Appendix-Location code to find out what the region codes stand for.

fields.name: request_id
fields.description: The log ID of a request, which uniquely identifies the request.
